s.text: A total of 2,500 sorted cells (30 ?l) and 250 target cells (30 ?l) were transferred to a microcentrifuge tube (VWR International, West Chester, Pennsylvania, United States), centrifuged 1 min at 200 g, and incubated 4 h at 37 ¡C.
Potential clones became visible around day 14 and were then transferred to 24-well plates containing 1 ml of CTL medium with 100 units/ml IL-2.
This suggests that the manner in which T cells are elicited in vivo are different in these two settings and may underlie their differences in biology.
Although heteroclitic peptide vaccination may drive T cells of mixed high and low RE, such a strong stimulus may be needed to induce an initial de novo T cell response.
While Malme-3M and mel526 express both MART and gp100, A375 does not express MART or gp100 and served as a negative control.
